analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po la phyag 'tshal lo // mi gnas rnam rtog kun bral ba'i //
translated: Homage to glorious great bliss.🔽The nature of all buddhas,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid dngos // rang rig brjod du med pa yi //
translated: free from all conceptual states and non-abiding,🔽is the great wisdom of self-awareness,

original: ye shes chen po la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: ye shes chen po la phyag 'tshal //
translated: inexpressible, to that I pay homage.🔽This unsurpassed supreme tantra,

original: phal pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i //🔽bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi mchog /'di la gzhan gyis gsol bskul bas //
analyzed: phal pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i // bla na med pa'i rgyud kyi mchog /'di la gzhan gyis gsol bskul bas //
translated: not the domain of ordinary beings,

original: ji bzhin don gyis gsal bar bya //
analyzed: ji bzhin don gyis gsal bar bya //
translated: is clarified according to its meaning🔽by others' requests.

original: drang ba dang ni nges pa'i don //
analyzed: drang ba dang ni nges pa'i don //
translated: The provisional and definitive meanings

original: rdo rje 'dzin pas gsungs pa las //🔽nges pa la ni rim pa bzhin //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pas gsungs pa las // nges pa la ni rim pa bzhin //
translated: were taught by Vajradhara.🔽From that, the definitive meaning

original: ji bzhin don gyis dbye bar bya //
analyzed: ji bzhin don gyis dbye bar bya //
translated: should be classified according to its meaning.

original: 'di la rdo rje tshig mang ldan //
analyzed: 'di la rdo rje tshig mang ldan //
translated: This has many vajra words,

original: de nyid dam pa 'bras bu'i don //
analyzed: de nyid dam pa 'bras bu'i don //
translated: the meaning of the result of suchness.

original: yid bzhin rin chen nor bu yis //
analyzed: yid bzhin rin chen nor bu yis //
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel🔽is the garland itself, the lord of pervasion,

original: phreng ba nyid ni khyab ba'i bdag / dgos pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: phreng ba nyid ni khyab ba'i bdag / dgos pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub byed pa //
translated: accomplishing the characteristics of the necessary.

original: 'grel 'di de bzhin bdag gis khyab //
analyzed: 'grel 'di de bzhin bdag gis khyab //
translated: This commentary is likewise pervaded by me.

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus have I heard, etc.

original: 'di skad ni skyon dang bral ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin ston pa la'o /
analyzed: 'di skad ni skyon dang bral ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin ston pa la'o /
translated: Thus is the way of teaching free from faults, just as it is.

original: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba ni sdud par byed pa kho nas thos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba ni sdud par byed pa kho nas thos pa yin gyi /
translated: I have heard means that it was heard by the compiler alone.

original: gzhan du brgyud pa dang gzhan nas thos pas byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du brgyud pa dang gzhan nas thos pas byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It did not arise from hearing from another or from hearsay.

original: 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa kho na la thos pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa kho na la thos pa'o //
translated: In order to eliminate error, it was heard from Vajradhara himself.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi bha ga la 'khor dang bcas pa bzhugs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi bha ga la 'khor dang bcas pa bzhugs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At one time means at the time of the retinue abiding in the bhaga of wisdom.

original: de yang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas khyad par can ni 'khor dpa' bo dang dpa' mor bcas pa bzhugs pa'i dus gcig go //
analyzed: de yang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas khyad par can ni 'khor dpa' bo dang dpa' mor bcas pa bzhugs pa'i dus gcig go //
translated: Moreover, at one time is the time of the special, concordant place, where the retinue of heroes and heroines abide.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud rnam pa bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he has conquered the four demons.

original: yang na legs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: yang na legs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Or else, because he possesses excellent qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rigs lnga'i bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rigs lnga'i bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagatas are the Sugatas of the five families, etc.

original: rigs kyis phye ba ni bde ba chen po nyid las gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyis phye ba ni bde ba chen po nyid las gshegs pa ste /
translated: The one distinguished by family is the one who has gone to the state of great bliss,

original: gdul bya'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro // yang na de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa ste /
translated: because he acts for the benefit of those to be trained.

original: sangs @281a * //
analyzed: sangs @281a * //
translated: Or else, he is the one who has gone to suchness,

original: rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Buddhas Vairochana, etc.

original: thams cad na ni ji snyed pa bzhugs lus med pa de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis mtshon pa kun bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad na ni ji snyed pa bzhugs lus med pa de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis mtshon pa kun bsdu ba yin no //
translated: All of them, as many as there are, are included in the Tathagatas who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje //
translated: Body, Speech and Mind are vajra.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Thus, because the body, speech, and mind of all the Buddhas is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the Vajra Lord, he is the Vajra Holder.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de bzhin du lha mo'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de bzhin du lha mo'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa ni /
translated: The Bodhisattvas and likewise the goddesses who reside in the form of🔽heroes and heroines

original: dpa' bo chen po dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: are the lords of the great heroes and heroines.

original: sa bcu la gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyid las sprul pa'i 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la bskor nas bzhugs te /
analyzed: sa bcu la gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyid las sprul pa'i 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la bskor nas bzhugs te /
translated: The Bodhisattvas, who are in the manner of abiding on the ten stages, are the retinue emanated from himself, who surround the Lord.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi bha ga'i nang gzhal yas khang khyad par can na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi bha ga'i nang gzhal yas khang khyad par can na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: They reside in the special celestial mansion in the bhaga of wisdom, which is the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa rnams bzhugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa rnams bzhugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The Lord, who is the nature of the three bodies, and the retinue are said to reside.

original: der bcom ldan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bzhugs pa'i gnas de ru bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: der bcom ldan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bzhugs pa'i gnas de ru bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas te /
translated: means that he pleased the Blessed One in various ways,

original: gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: with the meaning of he made a request.

original: 'di skad ces gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa'o //
translated: He said, Thus, etc. , is the question.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di rnams la nang la sogs pa'i don gyis bshad pa yin zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di rnams la nang la sogs pa'i don gyis bshad pa yin zhes smra'o //
translated: Others say that these are explained by the meaning of inner, etc.

original: de ni 'gal te rgyud kyi bka' nyams pa'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'gal te rgyud kyi bka' nyams pa'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: That is contradictory, because it violates the statement of the tantra, and so should not be taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, Thus, etc.

original: de la ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi don thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir na sdom pa yang gsungs so //🔽'dir bsdus nas ston pa yin la /
analyzed: de la ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi don thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir na sdom pa yang gsungs so // 'dir bsdus nas ston pa yin la /
translated: There, evam maya means that because it includes all the meanings of the tantra, it is also a summary.🔽Here it is taught in summary.

original: rgyas pa ni 'di nyid kyi 'og nas bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni 'di nyid kyi 'og nas bstan to //
translated: The extensive [teaching] is taught below in this very [tantra].

original: rgyud gzhan nas sdom pa'i don gyis shes rab thabs dang / a'a li dang k'a li dang / 'khor lo bzhi dang / lha mo dang skad cig bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dang / de kho na nyid bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan nas sdom pa'i don gyis shes rab thabs dang / a'a li dang k'a li dang / 'khor lo bzhi dang / lha mo dang skad cig bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dang / de kho na nyid bzhi dang / bden pa bzhi dang /
translated: In other tantras, these four syllables are applied to wisdom and method, to āli and kāli, to the four wheels, to the four goddesses and moments, to the four joys, to the four realities, to the four truths,

original: sde pa bzhi dang / dbyu gu la sogs par yi ge bzhi po 'di dag rnams sbyar bar gsungs so //
analyzed: sde pa bzhi dang / dbyu gu la sogs par yi ge bzhi po 'di dag rnams sbyar bar gsungs so //
translated: to the four classes of tantra, and to the hours of the day, and so on.

original: gzhan nas de bas kyang rgyas par bstan pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nas de bas kyang rgyas par bstan pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: There are also other extensive explanations.

original: 'o na @281b yang mi 'gal bar bstan dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na @281b yang mi 'gal bar bstan dgos so //
translated: Now, it must be shown that there is no contradiction.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bzhugs pa yan chad bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bzhugs pa yan chad bsdu ba ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the rest up to “abiding.”

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi bha ga la bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi bha ga la bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: “Thus have I heard at one time” up to “abiding in the bhaga of wisdom.”

original: khams zhes bya ba'i sgras 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba'i sgras 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The term “elements” refers to the primary elements.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ngo //
translated: They are earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: srid pa gsum gyi ngo bo lus ngag yid dang ldan pa ni 'dod khams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rang rang gi yang khams te gsum mo //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi ngo bo lus ngag yid dang ldan pa ni 'dod khams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rang rang gi yang khams te gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are the nature of body, speech, and mind, and they are the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness, each of which is a realm.

original: 'gro ba ni rnam pa lnga'i rigs kyi sems can /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni rnam pa lnga'i rigs kyi sems can /
translated: The five kinds of beings are the sentient beings of the five destinies.

original: mi 'gro ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin //
analyzed: mi 'gro ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin //
translated: The non-beings are the nature of the world of the container.

original: yang na mi 'gro ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mi 'gro ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: Or else, the non-beings are the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ni shes rab de dang ldan pa'i thabs ni dngos po'i ye shes so //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ni shes rab de dang ldan pa'i thabs ni dngos po'i ye shes so //
translated: The four seals are the wisdom of the method endowed with that wisdom, and the wisdom of things.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dga' ba nyid kyis khyab cing rgyas btab nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dga' ba nyid kyis khyab cing rgyas btab nas bzhugs so //
translated: By nature means that it is pervaded and sealed by the very delight of the nature.

original: de yang kun gyi snying po dam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang kun gyi snying po dam pa ste /
translated: And that is the highest essence of all.

original: kun la gnas pa'i phyir rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: kun la gnas pa'i phyir rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: It is sealed because it is present in all.

original: rnam par rtog pas mi 'phrogs pa rang bzhin gyis 'od rab spros pa dang bral ba la ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas mi 'phrogs pa rang bzhin gyis 'od rab spros pa dang bral ba la ni /
translated: The nature that is not carried away by conceptualization, the natural light that is free from elaborations,

original: gzhan gyis ma yin kun rgyas btab //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma yin kun rgyas btab //
translated: is not something else, but is sealed by all.

original: ces bya'o // de skad du /🔽tshangs pa'i g-yul sa byed pa mthar //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de skad du / tshangs pa'i g-yul sa byed pa mthar //
translated: And so it is said:🔽Having made the field of Brahma's battle

original: legs dgyes khyed kyis rab btab nas //
analyzed: legs dgyes khyed kyis rab btab nas //
translated: the seal of your great joy,

original: grangs med pa la rgyas btab ste //🔽de bas phyag rgya chen khyod grags //
analyzed: grangs med pa la rgyas btab ste // de bas phyag rgya chen khyod grags //
translated: you have sealed it with the countless,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore you are renowned as the great seal.

original: dri med rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid //
analyzed: dri med rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid //
translated: The result is the immaculate perfection itself.

original: ces bya ba ni de nyid la 'bras bu zhes bya ba dang / de kho na nyid dang mchog tu gyur pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa rnam grangs su phye na mang yang ngo bo ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bde ba chen po nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de nyid la 'bras bu zhes bya ba dang / de kho na nyid dang mchog tu gyur pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa rnam grangs su phye na mang yang ngo bo ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bde ba chen po nyid do //
translated: Thus it is called, because it is called the result in itself, and because it is the reality, the supreme, the unborn, the unceasing, and so on, which, although classified in many ways, is in essence the nondual pristine awareness itself, the great bliss.

original: de rgyud 'di nas gsal bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi sgron mar grags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rgyud 'di nas gsal bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi sgron mar grags zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is clearly taught in this tantra, it is called the lamp of reality.

original: de'i don rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i don rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of that is taught extensively:🔽Thus have I heard, etc.

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ae wam thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ae wam thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud ces bya ste /
translated: E-VAM is called the tantra of method and wisdom.

original: rgyud ni rgyun gyis rtag par gnas pa thabs dang shes rab ni yab yum sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde ba dang bcas pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun gyis rtag par gnas pa thabs dang shes rab ni yab yum sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde ba dang bcas pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: A tantra is a continuous, constant abiding, with the method and wisdom being the nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind of the father and mother, along with the aspect of bliss.

original: sku mtshan dang dpe byad dang gsung yig 'bru'i rnam pa dang @282a * //
analyzed: sku mtshan dang dpe byad dang gsung yig 'bru'i rnam pa dang @282a * //
translated: The body is the major and minor marks, the speech is the aspect of the seed syllables,

original: thugs byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde ba'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: thugs byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde ba'i bye brag ste /
translated: and the mind is the form of the bodhisattvas, the nature of the vajra, and the specific bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i rgyud do //
translated: This is the tantra of indivisibility with the Bhagavān Vajradhara.

original: thabs ni rdo rje rin po che'i byang chub sems kyi don gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni rdo rje rin po che'i byang chub sems kyi don gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The method is the aspect of the meaning of the vajra jewel bodhicitta, and so on.

original: shes rab ni padma can gyi rnam par te gnas kyi khyad par gyi rim pas so //
analyzed: shes rab ni padma can gyi rnam par te gnas kyi khyad par gyi rim pas so //
translated: Wisdom is the lotus, and so on, in the sequence of the special places.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As such,

original: ae yi yi ge dbyibs bzang gang //
analyzed: ae yi yi ge dbyibs bzang gang //
translated: the shape of the syllable e is excellent.

original: de dbus wam gyis rab tu brgyan //
analyzed: de dbus wam gyis rab tu brgyan //
translated: In the center of that, it is fully ornamented with the syllable vam.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
translated: The Buddha is the jewel casket, the basis of all bliss.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ma y'a zhes bya ba'i sgras sdud pa po nyid bcom ldan mo bdag gis thos pa yin la /
analyzed: ma y'a zhes bya ba'i sgras sdud pa po nyid bcom ldan mo bdag gis thos pa yin la /
translated: The word “I” indicates that the compiler himself, Bhagavatī, heard it.

original: de sku'i rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de sku'i rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is the form of the body, and so on.🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: de yang / 'di skad bdag gis de nyid gsum //
analyzed: de yang / 'di skad bdag gis de nyid gsum //
translated: Thus, I heard this reality

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje dang bcas pa'i yig 'bru'i rang bzhin zla ba'i rang bzhin ga bur dang gsum du dbye ba'i cha dang / thig le dang tshul sdud pa po dang / rgyud bcas pa phyi'i gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje dang bcas pa'i yig 'bru'i rang bzhin zla ba'i rang bzhin ga bur dang gsum du dbye ba'i cha dang / thig le dang tshul sdud pa po dang / rgyud bcas pa phyi'i gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas /
translated: The three realities are the three divisions of the nature of the body, speech, and mind, the nature of the syllables with the vajra, the nature of the moon, and the nature of camphor.

original: bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das mos sngon bskul ba byas nas rgyud gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa las thos par gyur pa ni gsang ba'i padma'i lte ba las bzhengs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das mos sngon bskul ba byas nas rgyud gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa las thos par gyur pa ni gsang ba'i padma'i lte ba las bzhengs te /
translated: The Bhagavatī implored the Bhagavat to teach the tantra in the past, and in the same way, here, she implored and requested him, and he arose from the center of the secret lotus and heard it.

original: bde ba chen po'i bcom ldan 'das la bskul ba byas pas /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i bcom ldan 'das la bskul ba byas pas /
translated: Having implored the Bhagavat of great bliss,

original: sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul gyis thos pa'am /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul gyis thos pa'am /
translated: It is heard in the sense that it is the nature of the vajra body, speech and mind.🔽

original: go bar gyur pa ni zla ba bde ba mchog thos pa dga' ba'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: go bar gyur pa ni zla ba bde ba mchog thos pa dga' ba'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: The way of hearing or understanding the nature of the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the experience of the aspect of the joy of hearing the supreme bliss of the moon.

original: sku la sogs pa'i don gyis sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba gsum mo //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i don gyis sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba gsum mo //
translated: The three joys of emanation, enjoyment, and dharma are by the meaning of body and so on.

original: rang bzhin bde ba chen po dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin bde ba chen po dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Possessing the nature of great bliss is

original: bdag nyid kyis dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dang bcas pa ste //
translated: accompanied by oneself.

original: rang bzhin bzhi yi bye brag tu //
analyzed: rang bzhin bzhi yi bye brag tu //
translated: The four natures are distinguished.

original: zhes bya'o // rang bzhin dga' ba tshul tsam dang bcas pa'i rdo rje nyid las ma 'phros pa ni 'bras bu'i don dam pa spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rang bzhin dga' ba tshul tsam dang bcas pa'i rdo rje nyid las ma 'phros pa ni 'bras bu'i don dam pa spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature of joy, merely accompanied by the mode, is the vajra itself, not emanated from the ultimate result, free from proliferation.

original: de la ni /
analyzed: de la ni /
translated: In that,

original: don dam par ni shes par bya //
analyzed: don dam par ni shes par bya //
translated: it should be known as ultimate.

original: zhes so // shes rab kyi bha ga'i gnas su zla ba bde ba mchog gi sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: zhes so // shes rab kyi bha ga'i gnas su zla ba bde ba mchog gi sgrar bshad de /
translated: The place of the bhaga of wisdom is explained as the sound of the supreme bliss of the moon.

original: phyi la sogs pa'i rim pas phye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: phyi la sogs pa'i rim pas phye ba'i gnas so //
translated: It is the place distinguished by the stages of the outer and so on.

original: de khyad par can gyi gnas su gshegs pa ni 'gog go //
analyzed: de khyad par can gyi gnas su gshegs pa ni 'gog go //
translated: His going to a special place is stopped.

original: ye shes kyi stobs su gyur pas na @282b gzhan mchog ste gnas de rang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs su gyur pas na @282b gzhan mchog ste gnas de rang ngo //
translated: Since he has become the power of wisdom, he is the best of others, that is, in that place.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad kyi gnas gcig pa ni thos pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad kyi gnas gcig pa ni thos pa'i don to //
translated: The single place of all the Bhagavans together with their retinues is the meaning of hearing.

original: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Since he does not abide in the two extremes, he has abandoned existence and nirvana.

original: de ni dga' ba gnyis kyi rtog pa med pa yab yum thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dga' ba gnyis kyi rtog pa med pa yab yum thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is without the concepts of the two joys, the father and mother, method and wisdom, inseparable, free from the two.

original: bzang ba dang ngan pa dang bral ba bsam du med pa'i dus te /
analyzed: bzang ba dang ngan pa dang bral ba bsam du med pa'i dus te /
translated: Free from good and bad, it is the inconceivable time,

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i dus so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i dus so //
translated: the time endowed with nondual wisdom.

original: de nyid phyag rgya chen po bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa dang bral zhes de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya chen po bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa dang bral zhes de nyid la bya'o //
translated: That itself is the great seal, free from creation and completion.

original: 'o na yang 'bras bu'i ming rgyu la btags pa'o ;
analyzed: 'o na yang 'bras bu'i ming rgyu la btags pa'o ;
translated: Moreover, the name of the result is imputed to the cause.

original: / de bas na /
analyzed: / de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mtha' zhes bya //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mtha' zhes bya //
translated: the Bhagavān is called the end.

original: rang bzhin dga' ba nyams myong dngos //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dga' ba nyams myong dngos // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The experience of natural joy.

original: yang nar rtsa ba'i padma'i gnas mchog tu phra ba dang ldan pas cha /
analyzed: yang nar rtsa ba'i padma'i gnas mchog tu phra ba dang ldan pas cha /
translated: Again, the supreme abode of the root lotus is endowed with subtlety and is the essence of the bindu.

original: byang chub sems ga bur gyi gzugs kyis thig le nyid /
analyzed: byang chub sems ga bur gyi gzugs kyis thig le nyid /
translated: The bodhicitta in the form of camphor is the bindu.

original: ye shes gsal bas de rang nyid tshul te de kho na nyid gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsal bas de rang nyid tshul te de kho na nyid gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: Since pristine consciousness is clear, it is the mode of that itself, which is called the “three suchnesses.”

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ye shes sbyor ba'i tshul tsam /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ye shes sbyor ba'i tshul tsam /
translated: The mere mode of the union of the pristine consciousness of the variety of appearances🔽is the supreme moon of bliss, the form of the white bindu that increases bliss.

original: de dkar ba'i gzugs bde ba shin tu 'phel ba ni zla ba bde mchog / de nyid kyis rang bzhin rnams rgyas btab pa'i ngo bos phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: de dkar ba'i gzugs bde ba shin tu 'phel ba ni zla ba bde mchog / de nyid kyis rang bzhin rnams rgyas btab pa'i ngo bos phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: Since that itself is the essence of the seal of the natural maṇḍala, it is mahāmudrā.🔽Since it is not tainted by the faults of those, it is the supreme other.

original: de rnams kyi skyon gyis ma gos pa ni gzhan mchog / rang bzhin dga' ba nyid dga' ba kun gyi mthar thug pas ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi skyon gyis ma gos pa ni gzhan mchog / rang bzhin dga' ba nyid dga' ba kun gyi mthar thug pas ni mtha' ste /
translated: Since natural joy is the ultimate of all joys, it is the end.

original: ye shes de rnams kun rdzob pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes de rnams kun rdzob pa'i don to //
translated: Those pristine consciousnesses are the relative reality.

original: de bzhin du yang rkang mthil du cha'i dngos po /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rkang mthil du cha'i dngos po /
translated: Similarly, the essence of the bindu is the thing of the sole of the foot.

original: de snying gar thig le bzhugs pa'i gnas su tshul //
analyzed: de snying gar thig le bzhugs pa'i gnas su tshul //
translated: That is the way of the bindu existing in the heart center.🔽

original: de kho na nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum mo //
translated: That is the way of the three realities in the abode of the bindu at the heart.

original: dpag med pa'i gnas su tshul tsam zla ba mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpag med pa'i gnas su tshul tsam zla ba mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The three realities are the way of the mere moon endowed with the supreme moon in the abode of the immeasurable.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i sems kyi gnas su mchog / phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i sems kyi gnas su mchog / phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin /
translated: The supreme abode of the mind of the dharmacakra is the nature of the great seal.

original: longs spyod 'khor lo'i dbus kyi gnas su ni gzhan mchog gi ngo bo mtha'/
analyzed: longs spyod 'khor lo'i dbus kyi gnas su ni gzhan mchog gi ngo bo mtha'/
translated: The supreme abode in the center of the enjoyment chakra is the limit that is the nature of the supreme other.

original: zla ba rgyas pa'i gnas su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba rgyas pa'i gnas su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The abode of the full moon is perfection.

original: rang bzhin dga' ba sku gsum gyi bdag nyid brjod pa dang bral ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin dga' ba sku gsum gyi bdag nyid brjod pa dang bral ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the inexpressible is the three-kaya nature of natural joy.

original: yang rgyud ye shes thig le las ni de ltar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rgyud ye shes thig le las ni de ltar ma gsungs so //
translated: Also, the Tantra of the Drop of Pristine Awareness does not teach that in that way.

original: gzhan dag snying ga'i mi shigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de kho na nyid gsum la sogs pa'i don gyis bstan pa dang / de nas rim pas longs spyod 'khor lor bstan pa de nas bde ba chen por @283a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag snying ga'i mi shigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de kho na nyid gsum la sogs pa'i don gyis bstan pa dang / de nas rim pas longs spyod 'khor lor bstan pa de nas bde ba chen por @283a * //
translated: Others teach the three realities and so on by means of the nature of the indestructible at the heart and then gradually teach it at the enjoyment chakra and then at the great-bliss chakra.

original: rdzogs pa'o // de yang dang por de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid snying gar gnas pa las /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'o // de yang dang por de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid snying gar gnas pa las /
translated: Moreover, first, having the nature of the three realities, it abides in the heart.🔽The upward emission of light rays melts the moon, and the bliss becomes the supreme moon, the great seal of supreme bliss, in the dharmacakra.🔽The six yogas are generated.

original: gyen la 'od zer spros pa des zla ba zhu bas bde bar gyur pa zla ba bde mchog phyag rgya chen po chos kyi 'khor lor mtha' dang gzhan mchog / de ni skyed pa'i sbyor drug / de longs spyod la sogs pa sngar bstan pa byas pa ni
analyzed: gyen la 'od zer spros pa des zla ba zhu bas bde bar gyur pa zla ba bde mchog phyag rgya chen po chos kyi 'khor lor mtha' dang gzhan mchog / de ni skyed pa'i sbyor drug / de longs spyod la sogs pa sngar bstan pa byas pa ni
translated: The performance of the enjoyment and so forth previously explained is

original: sbyor ba drug rdzogs pa'i don to zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba drug rdzogs pa'i don to zhes smra'o //
translated: the meaning of the completion of the six yogas.

original: thams cad ye shes gsum stong nyid //
analyzed: thams cad ye shes gsum stong nyid //
translated: All are the three wisdoms and emptiness.

original: ces bya ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa gsum gyi rim pas shar tsam na rnam par rtog pa stong pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa gsum gyi rim pas shar tsam na rnam par rtog pa stong pa'o //
translated: This means that all phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana, when they merely arise in the sequence of the three aspects, are empty of conceptuality.

original: de yang phung po dang rtsa dang khu ba'i gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la yang snang ba gsum gyi rim pas 'byung zhing ldan te 'khor ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang phung po dang rtsa dang khu ba'i gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la yang snang ba gsum gyi rim pas 'byung zhing ldan te 'khor ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, for all sentient beings endowed with the form of the aggregates, channels, and fluids, the three appearances arise and are present in sequence, the nature of cyclic existence.

original: 'di gsal bar snang ba'i skabs su 'og nas bshad /
analyzed: 'di gsal bar snang ba'i skabs su 'og nas bshad /
translated: This will be explained below in the context of the clear appearance.

original: 'o na yang sku gsung thugs rtsa'i don gyis bstan pa'i dga' ba gsum gyi ye shes snang bas thams cad do //
analyzed: 'o na yang sku gsung thugs rtsa'i don gyis bstan pa'i dga' ba gsum gyi ye shes snang bas thams cad do //
translated: Now, all things are pervaded by the pristine consciousness of the three joys, which are explained by the meaning of the nāḍīs of body, speech, and mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa rim pas chung ba ni stong pa stong nyid ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rim pas chung ba ni stong pa stong nyid ye shes so //
translated: The stages of the small conceptual thoughts are the emptiness of emptiness, the pristine consciousness of emptiness.

original: rnam rtog mtshan ma'i snang ba spangs pa ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog mtshan ma'i snang ba spangs pa ni stong pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the sign of conceptual thought is abandoned.

original: de nyid kyis ni spangs pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni spangs pa'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is abandoned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas phung po lnga la sogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas phung po lnga la sogs pa /
translated: The tathāgata is the five aggregates, and so on.

original: phung po'i sgras rnam par shes pa byang chub kyi sems 'od rab kyi gnas nas de bzhin nyid las gshegs pa'i don to //
analyzed: phung po'i sgras rnam par shes pa byang chub kyi sems 'od rab kyi gnas nas de bzhin nyid las gshegs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “gone to suchness from the location of the bodhicitta of the aggregate of consciousness” is the meaning of “tathāgata.”

original: de yang snang ba gsum gyi rim pas rang bzhin bzhi ba rdo rje'i sprul par gshegs pa dang / slar nyid kyi gnas su gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang snang ba gsum gyi rim pas rang bzhin bzhi ba rdo rje'i sprul par gshegs pa dang / slar nyid kyi gnas su gshegs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, by the sequence of the three appearances, he goes to the fourth nature, the vajra emanation, and then returns to his own place.

original: rnam 'byed grags zhes bya ba ni gsum po la rtogs pa bag chags yod pa 'byed pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'byed grags zhes bya ba ni gsum po la rtogs pa bag chags yod pa 'byed pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The analysis called “fame” is the analysis that distinguishes the existence of the habitual tendencies of realization in the three.

original: dang po'i gnas ni rab 'grub byed //
analyzed: dang po'i gnas ni rab 'grub byed //
translated: The first place is the one that is accomplished.

original: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po las gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyis byon nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po las gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyis byon nas /
translated: Having come from the great bliss by the characteristic of the form body,

original: yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin 'od rab tu gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin 'od rab tu gshegs pa ste /
translated: he again enters into the nature of great bliss.

original: don du bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gshegs ni dang po'i gnas so //
analyzed: don du bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gshegs ni dang po'i gnas so //
translated: In reality, having gone to the wheel of great bliss, it is the first place.

original: de ni phung po la sogs thams cad bde ba chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po la sogs thams cad bde ba chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: That is the transformation of all the aggregates and so forth into great bliss.

original: sku ni phyi la sogs pa'i don gyis dbye bar bya /
analyzed: sku ni phyi la sogs pa'i don gyis dbye bar bya /
translated: The body is to be distinguished by the meaning of outer and so forth.

original: de bzhin du snga phyi bstan pa spang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga phyi bstan pa spang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the teaching of earlier and later should be abandoned.

original: sku mthong bas dga' ba'i ngo bor gyur to //
analyzed: sku mthong bas dga' ba'i ngo bor gyur to //
translated: The body becomes the essence of joy from seeing.

original: de la thabs dang @283b shes rab kyis pho dang mo'i dbang po'i rnam par rtog pa 'gags te /
analyzed: de la thabs dang @283b shes rab kyis pho dang mo'i dbang po'i rnam par rtog pa 'gags te /
translated: There, the concepts of the male and female organs are stopped by means of method and wisdom.

original: mi skye bas na bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye bas na bral ba'o //
translated: Since they do not arise, they are “free.”

original: byung ba'i sgras khu ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi rtog pa dang yang bral ba'o //🔽de bzhin du bde ba'i dga' ba'i rim pa la sogs pa ni phyag rgya bzhi la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis byas pas phyir na rang bzhin dga'
analyzed: byung ba'i sgras khu ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi rtog pa dang yang bral ba'o // de bzhin du bde ba'i dga' ba'i rim pa la sogs pa ni phyag rgya bzhi la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis byas pas phyir na rang bzhin dga'
translated: The word “arisen” also means free from the concepts of substances such as semen.🔽Similarly, the stages of the joy of bliss and so on are the abandonment of concepts based on the four mudras.

original: ba'i thugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i thugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas are created by the Bhagavān himself, they are the nature of the mind of innate joy, and so on.

original: de yang lam gyi rim pas dbye ba ni bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang lam gyi rim pas dbye ba ni bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the division by means of the stages of the path is the action.

original: lha mo dbang chen nyi ma skyes //
analyzed: lha mo dbang chen nyi ma skyes //
translated: The goddess born from the sun of great power

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dpa' bo chen po'i sgras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sku'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po'i sgras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sku'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The word “great hero” is the form of the bodies of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du dpal lha mo rnams kyang bstan pa de rang nyid la bshad pa a'a li dang rtsa ba'i rim pa dang / byang chub sems thig le bcu drug / dpa' mo'i rtsa'i 'khor lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal lha mo rnams kyang bstan pa de rang nyid la bshad pa a'a li dang rtsa ba'i rim pa dang / byang chub sems thig le bcu drug / dpa' mo'i rtsa'i 'khor lo //
translated: In the same way, the glorious goddesses are explained to be the teaching itself, the āli and kāli, the root and branch cakras, the bodhicitta, the sixteen bindus, and the reality of the nāḍīs of the heroines.

original: de bzhin lte bar byang chub sems thig le bcu drug /
analyzed: de bzhin lte bar byang chub sems thig le bcu drug /
translated: In the same way, the sixteen bindus of bodhicitta are at the navel.

original: g-yas g-yon bcu drug phrag gnyis dpa' mo rtsa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon bcu drug phrag gnyis dpa' mo rtsa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The two sets of sixteen on the right and left are the reality of the nāḍīs of the heroines.

original: dpa' bo mchog gi dga' ba dang dpa' mo bral ba'i dga' ba zhus pa dang 'pho ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo mchog gi dga' ba dang dpa' mo bral ba'i dga' ba zhus pa dang 'pho ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The supreme joy of the hero and the joy of the heroine are free from transference and destruction.

original: dpa' bo byang chub sems ga bur dpa' mo lte ba'i snying po //
analyzed: dpa' bo byang chub sems ga bur dpa' mo lte ba'i snying po //
translated: The camphor of the bodhicitta of the hero is the essence of the navel of the heroine.

original: rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das la bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das la bskor ba'o //
translated: The natural maṇḍala is circumambulated by the Bhagavān.

original: rnam par bskor ro zhes pas lha la sogs pa'i gzugs rtsa dang byang chub sems kyi yi ge la sogs pas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bskor ro zhes pas lha la sogs pa'i gzugs rtsa dang byang chub sems kyi yi ge la sogs pas bskor ba'o //
translated: “Circumambulated” means that the forms of the deities and so on are circumambulated by the syllables of the nāḍīs and bodhicitta.

original: yan lag ni de rnams thams cad bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag ni de rnams thams cad bsdu ba'o //
translated: “Limbs” means that all of those are included.

original: khyab pa'i chu yis padma bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyab pa'i chu yis padma bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a lotus by the water of pervasion.

original: gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the nature of the principal.

original: dper bstan pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dper bstan pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is like the example.

original: shes rab de ni tshangs pa'i gnas //
analyzed: shes rab de ni tshangs pa'i gnas //
translated: That wisdom is the abode of Brahma.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas dang rten dang bzhi ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas dang rten dang bzhi ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The abode, the support, and the four synonyms.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i gnas kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i gnas kyi khyad par te /
translated: It is the special abode free from conceptualization.

analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems kyi zla ba'i rang bzhin la tshangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the nature of the moon of bodhicitta is called Brahma.🔽Therefore,

analyzed: de'i phyir / tshangs pa ye shes 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it holds the wisdom of Brahma,

analyzed: zhes so // ye shes bral ba'i dga' bar 'dzin pa ni rang bzhin dga' bar 'dzin pa'o //

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni nyon @284a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni nyon @284a * //
translated: Attachment and so on are the Mara of the afflictions.

original: mongs pa'o // na tsha la sogs pa phung po'i dang tshe dang dbang po 'gags pa 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: mongs pa'o // na tsha la sogs pa phung po'i dang tshe dang dbang po 'gags pa 'chi bdag gi bdud do //

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po 'joms pa ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po 'joms pa ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: Here, the destruction of conceptual things is by the Blessed One, who is naturally joyful.

original: yang na longs spyod myong bas so //
analyzed: yang na longs spyod myong bas so //
translated: Or, it is by experiencing the enjoyment.

original: zhes bya ba ni drug dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid ro dang ye shes longs spyod na bcom ldan 'das bha ga'i don gcig pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drug dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid ro dang ye shes longs spyod na bcom ldan 'das bha ga'i don gcig pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One is the one who has the meaning of the bhaga, who has the nature of possessing the six, and who enjoys the enjoyment of taste and wisdom.

original: phyi nang gi rim pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the outer and inner sequence.

original: bzhugs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: bzhugs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de //
translated: It is the characteristic of abiding itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad dang yig 'bru la sogs pa sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad dang yig 'bru la sogs pa sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: The major and minor marks, syllables, and so on, have been explained previously.

original: de bzhin gnas pa yang na gshegs //
analyzed: de bzhin gnas pa yang na gshegs //
translated: Similarly, he abides or goes.

original: zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dbang gis gnas pa dang bzhugs pas mtshungs //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dbang gis gnas pa dang bzhugs pas mtshungs //
translated: Since he abides by the power of samaya, he is similar to the one who abides.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i don gyis gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i don gyis gshegs pa ste /
translated: He goes by the meaning of the jñānasattva.

original: sku'i rnam pas dbye ba dang / gsung dang thugs dang rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde bas dbyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i rnam pas dbye ba dang / gsung dang thugs dang rdo rje'i rang bzhin bde bas dbyer bar bya'o //
translated: It should be divided by the nature of body, speech, mind, and vajra bliss.

original: de lta bu'i don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges pa'i don gyis thabs kyi rim pa gang la brten kyang 'bras bu'i don dam pa rnyed de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges pa'i don gyis thabs kyi rim pa gang la brten kyang 'bras bu'i don dam pa rnyed de /
translated: By such a meaning ultimately, etc., it is the ultimate result that is attained, no matter what stage of method of definitive meaning one relies on.

original: 'dir 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa'i don gyis 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad bdag gis la sogs pa'i don gyis 'thob pa'o //
translated: Here, it is attained by the meaning of thus by me, etc.

original: thams cad rnal 'byor rgyud du gsang //
analyzed: thams cad rnal 'byor rgyud du gsang //
translated: All is secret in the Yoga Tantra.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor du sngags so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor du sngags so /
translated: By mantra in action, conduct, and yoga, etc., it is the mantra of action, conduct, and yoga.

original: rnal 'byor bla ma dang / rnal 'byor bla na med pa'i rgyud du nges pa dang drang ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bla ma dang / rnal 'byor bla na med pa'i rgyud du nges pa dang drang ba'o //
translated: It is definitive and interpretable in the Yoga Tantra and the Unsurpassed Yoga Tantra.

original: gzhan dag go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ae wam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yab yum thabs dang shes rab kyi rin po che dang padmar ldan pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'i gnas kyi rim pa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang gsum dang de dag rnams dang bcas pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ae wam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yab yum thabs dang shes rab kyi rin po che dang padmar ldan pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'i gnas kyi rim pa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang gsum dang de dag rnams dang bcas pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'o //
translated: The e and the va and so forth are the generation of the gnosis of the places of the cakras of the channels endowed with the jewels of the father and mother, method and wisdom, with sixty-four, eight, and three petals, respectively.

original: 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs pa'i sa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs pa'i sa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the abode of the vajra holder, the source of phenomena.

original: byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin dga' ba spros pa dang bral ba'i sa thams cad la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin dga' ba spros pa dang bral ba'i sa thams cad la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: The bodhicitta, the innate joy free from proliferation, is the lord of all the stages.

original: rgyud las ni rtag tu sprul pa sku'i sa bcu gcig pa zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud las ni rtag tu sprul pa sku'i sa bcu gcig pa zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: In the tantra, it is always called the eleventh stage of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa bcu gnyis pa //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa bcu gnyis pa //
translated: The enjoyment is the twelfth.

original: chos kyi sku ni bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bcu gsum pa //
translated: The dharmakāya is the thirteenth.

original: bcu bzhi bde ba chen po ste //🔽gang zhig bco lnga pa yis //
analyzed: bcu bzhi bde ba chen po ste // gang zhig bco lnga pa yis //
translated: The fourteenth is great bliss.

original: de ni ye shes sar bstan yin //
analyzed: de ni ye shes sar bstan yin //
translated: The fifteenth is the stage of the gnosis of the buddhas.

original: bcu drug sa ni brtag pa mi //
analyzed: bcu drug sa ni brtag pa mi //
translated: The sixteenth stage is not imagined.

original: de bzhin du rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is extensively taught.

original: de kun dga' ba'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: de kun dga' ba'i bye brag gis //
translated: And by the distinctions of joy,

original: sa yi sgra yis kun du btags //
analyzed: sa yi sgra yis kun du btags //
translated: the word “stage” is applied.

original: zhes @284b gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes @284b gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: der gang zhig de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ni sngon du ji skad smras pa dang / gnas skabs kyis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: der gang zhig de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ni sngon du ji skad smras pa dang / gnas skabs kyis shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the sequence beginning with “that which is the nature of the three realities” should be understood as previously stated and in terms of the situation.

original: dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba'i lan gsum shukra dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ye shes skye ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig pa'i don gyis de nyid la gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog gi dga' ba'i lan gsum shukra dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ye shes skye ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig pa'i don gyis de nyid la gsungs pa'o //
translated: The arising of the pristine consciousness of consciousness endowed with semen, which is the three joys and supreme joy, is stated in that reality by the meaning of mind, mental factors, and ignorance.

analyzed: de'i 'bar ba dang zhu ba dang 'dzag pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / dga' ba rnams dang / de bzhin du thun tshod dang 'pho ba rnams dang chu tshod dang / dbyug gu'i don rnams dbye ba ni nang gi rim pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Its blazing, melting, dripping, enjoyment, and joy, and likewise the periods, transits, hours, and the meanings of the staff are explained in terms of the inner sequence.

original: ma rig pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of the pristine wisdom of ignorance arises.

original: de dag rim pas 'byung ba las de kho na nyid ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag rim pas 'byung ba las de kho na nyid ni gsal ba'o //
translated: From their gradual arising, reality becomes clear.

analyzed: yang na bral ba'i dga' ba las de nyid der gsal bar bstan te /
translated: Or, from the joy of separation, reality becomes clear there.

original: de yang bzang ba dang ngan pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang bzang ba dang ngan pa gnyis te /
translated: That also is twofold: good and bad.

original: bzang po'i don rnyed pa ni bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: bzang po'i don rnyed pa ni bzhi pa'o ;
translated: The attainment of the good meaning is the fourth.

original: / de skad du /
analyzed: / de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ji ltar mun pa'i rin po che //
analyzed: ji ltar mun pa'i rin po che //
translated: Just as a jewel in the dark

original: mar me med na mthong ba med //
analyzed: mar me med na mthong ba med //
translated: is not seen without a lamp,

original: de bzhin de kho na nyid ni //
analyzed: de bzhin de kho na nyid ni //
translated: so reality is attained

original: lam la sogs pa'i rim pas rnyed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: lam la sogs pa'i rim pas rnyed // ces gsungs so //
translated: by the stages of the path, etc.

analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: All phenomena are things of conceptualization.

analyzed: 'di rnams ni de kho na nyid gcig pus bcom zhing dben pa'o //
translated: They are destroyed and isolated by that reality alone.

analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu'i ming btags pa'o //
translated: The name of the result is imputed to the cause.

original: srog gi rlung yin pa /

analyzed: dbyug pa yang ni / byang chub kyi sems la kha cig 'dod do //
translated: The club is🔽some assert it is the bodhicitta.

original: la la ni byang chub kyi sems ni srog la /
analyzed: la la ni byang chub kyi sems ni srog la /
translated: Some assert that the bodhicitta is the life-force.

original: dbyug pa yang rtsa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa yang rtsa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: The staff is the nāḍī.

original: 'dir ni phyi dang nang gi rtsa la dbye bar bya ba ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i gnas su /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyi dang nang gi rtsa la dbye bar bya ba ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i gnas su /
translated: Here, the division of the outer and inner nāḍīs is the place of natural joy.

original: srog gi rlung gzung zhing dgug pa tsam gyis kyang rtsa mdud sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ye shes myong ba'i ror gcig pas na /
analyzed: srog gi rlung gzung zhing dgug pa tsam gyis kyang rtsa mdud sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa ye shes myong ba'i ror gcig pas na /
translated: By merely holding and drawing up the vāyu, since the thirty-two nāḍī knots and so on are of one taste in the experience of gnosis,

analyzed: de la de kho na nyid de bzhin du spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: that is the reality free from proliferation.

analyzed: dga' ba gsum gyi rim pas 'byung ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa gsum /
translated: The arising of the three joys is the three stages of generation.

analyzed: gyen du rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsum ni sbyor ba drug gi don to //
translated: The three stages of perfection are the meaning of the six applications.

analyzed: yang na autpala'i gnas su rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i don to //
translated: Or, the meaning of the stage of completion is in the place of the utpala.

original: mchog gi dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba'i don gyis shar ba dang nub pa dang / mi snang ba dang longs spyod rlung dang byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'o //

translated: The meaning of joy free from supreme joy is the characteristics of the vāyu and bodhicitta of arising, setting, nonappearance, and enjoyment.

original: yang rang bzhin dga' ba nyid la bshad @285a * //
analyzed: yang rang bzhin dga' ba nyid la bshad @285a * //
translated: Moreover, it is explained as the natural joy.

translated: From the union of the wind and the bodhicitta, the special joy endowed with natural joy, the movement in the upper and lower petals, is the mastery of the mind in the place of joy.

analyzed: mchog gi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bde ba chen po shar ba'o //
translated: The arising of great bliss through the stages of supreme joy and so on is the mastery of the mind in the place of supreme joy.

analyzed: rtsa dang byang chub sems su ldan nas gnas khyad par can du bzhag pas ni rang bzhin dga' ba rnyed pas /
translated: Endowed with the channels and bodhicitta, by placing it in a special place, natural joy is attained.

original: de lus la sogs pa'i yan lag rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lus la sogs pa'i yan lag rgyas pa yin no //
translated: That is the expansion of the branches of the body, and so on.

translated: The vase empowerment, the secret empowerment, the gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment, and the fourth empowerment are the stages of the empowerments endowed with joy and so on.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pa'i sems la dbang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pas chad pa'i dga' ba'i bdud rang bzhin dga' bas 'joms pas srung ba'i 'khor lo mchog tu bshad pa ste /

translated: The mind of the aspect of joy, together with the result of the fourth initiation, is the supreme protection wheel, because the demon of joy of the annihilationists is conquered by natural joy.

analyzed: rdo rje dang rin po che la sogs pa'i mtshams de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs mtshan no //
translated: The vajra, jewel, and so on are the heart-signs of the Tathagatas.

original: de yang re re'i dbye bas zur brgyad pa yang rim pas rgyas pa slob dpon kha cig gzhung gis 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang re re'i dbye bas zur brgyad pa yang rim pas rgyas pa slob dpon kha cig gzhung gis 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, some masters assert that the eight corners of each of those are expanded in sequence by the texts.

original: dad pa yin na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa yin na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If one has faith, one should accept them.

original: kho bos ni de bzhin mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bos ni de bzhin mi 'dod de /
translated: I do not assert that.

original: de'i don 'di nas mar gsal bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i don 'di nas mar gsal bar ston to //
translated: The meaning of that will be clearly shown below.

original: gsang ba chen pa'i ye shes mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan par bya ba ma yin pa la gsang ba /
analyzed: gsang ba chen pa'i ye shes mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan par bya ba ma yin pa la gsang ba /
translated: The supreme secret exalted wisdom and so on is the secret of what is not to be taught.

original: spros pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo /
translated: It is the nature of being completely free from all elaborations.

translated: This supreme great wisdom, which is not the domain of activity of śrāvakas and so on, is the lord of the earth merely by being heard and understood.

original: bsam pa dang bsgom pa smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom pa smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention reflection and meditation?

original: brjod du med pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain the inexpressible stage.

analyzed: brtson 'grus dang mi ldan na yang 'thob na brtson 'grus dang ldan na smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If one attains it even without diligence, what need is there to mention one who is diligent?

original: gdon mi za ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a promise that there is no doubt.

analyzed: de ni bdag nyid bcu drug bde //

translated: In the mantra of ālikāli, the essence mantra is oṃ and so on, and likewise, the essence mantra of the form of the letters of bodhicitta arranged in the places of the body and so on.

analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i yid kyi snying po'i sngags dang / de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs gnyis phrad pa'i sa'i don dam @285b pa'i sngags so // gang zhig sku brgyad mchod sbyin ni //
translated: Likewise, the mantra of the essence of the mind arisen from joy and so forth, and likewise the mantra of the ultimate reality of the stage of the union of wisdom and means.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i dga' ba'i ye shes de ltar rang bzhin dga' ba'i ye shes de bstan pa'o //

translated: Thus, by the meaning of the stages of the places, the intuition, the intuition born from the intuition, and the four essences, the result is complete, but it is known as the side of generation.🔽In order to distinguish it, the complete is known as the intuition born from the intuition.

analyzed: ji bzhin shes rab la sngar thal // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is just as it is known in the wisdom.

original: bcom ldan ye shes rin chen nyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan ye shes rin chen nyi //
translated: The Bhagavat is the jewel of intuition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe dang don gyi ngo bo bstod pa'i yon tan brjod par byas nas gsang ba'i gzhi dga' ba'i gzhi la sogs pa'i don la gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe dang don gyi ngo bo bstod pa'i yon tan brjod par byas nas gsang ba'i gzhi dga' ba'i gzhi la sogs pa'i don la gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: Thus, having expressed the praise of the qualities of the nature of the example and the meaning, the meaning of the basis of the secret, the basis of joy, and so on, is requested.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas dga' ba dang / snang ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: The enumeration of appearance, mind, emptiness, the moon, and so on is the meaning of joy and appearance in terms of variety.

original: de yang mi gsal ba'i phyogs kyis snang ba'i ye shes dga' ba'i sems kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ni gnas skabs dang @293a * //🔽sbyar ba'o // sems las byung ba snang ba mched pa'i ye shes te /

translated: Moreover, the special characteristic of the mind of joy, the pristine consciousness of appearance, is applied to the occasion by means of the unclear aspect.

original: mchog gi dga' ba bde ba'i ye shes de bas mchog go //
analyzed: mchog gi dga' ba bde ba'i ye shes de bas mchog go //
translated: The pristine consciousness of the increase of appearance that arises from the mind is the characteristic of supreme joy.

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes te /

analyzed: bral ba'i dka' ba bde ba'i ye shes shin tu mchog gi bdag nyid de bas lhag go //

original: sems ni mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: sems ni mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The mind has the nature of signs.

translated: In this way, the distinction of those intuitions is to be understood here by way of example and meaning. The mind is the intuition of appearance, having the notion of appearance, not the clarity of intuition.

translated: Thus, like the sky in autumn free of clouds pervaded by the light of the full moon, it is clear, and because all things are perceived, it is the intuition of appearance.

analyzed: nyin mo'i rang bzhin sems las byung ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: The nature of the day is the mind, which is the intuition of the increase of appearance, having the nature of the intuition of the increase of appearance.

original: yang ji ltar ston ka'i dus su nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis khyab pa bzhin du shin tu gsal zhing dri ma med pa nyid kyi dngos po ma lus pa thams cad dmigs pa snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'o //

translated: Again, just as in autumn the light of the sun's rays pervades, so all things without exception are very clear and stainless, the nature of the pristine consciousness of the appearance of the increase of the object.

original: ma rig mtshams kyi 'du shes can //
analyzed: ma rig mtshams kyi 'du shes can //
translated: Having the perception of the junction of ignorance

translated: has the perception of attaining appearance.

analyzed: mi rgyu ba'i bdag nyid snang ba thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Just as the darkness of night is subtle and pervades with the nature of selflessness, likewise, the pristine consciousness of attaining appearance is the nature of the movement of the life-force and exertion not moving.

original: yang dag rab 'od gsum dang bral //
analyzed: yang dag rab 'od gsum dang bral //
translated: Free from the three lights of utter purity

translated: has the nature of the light of pristine consciousness. Just as the darkness of the characteristics of the junction is abandoned in an instant, the nature of the rising sun is free from conceptuality, signs, and so on.

original: 'od rab dri ma med pa'i ye shes su gsal ba'i bde ba chen po kho na'o //
analyzed: 'od rab dri ma med pa'i ye shes su gsal ba'i bde ba chen po kho na'o //
translated: It is the great bliss that manifests as the pristine awareness of stainless light.🔽And it is said:🔽The nature of the bliss of the great seal

analyzed: de la / rang bzhin dga' ba'i mtshan nyid de //

analyzed: zhes gsungs so ; / de skad du 'di nyid su // dang por dga' ba dang bcas pa //
translated: And it is said:🔽First, with joy,

analyzed: las dang po la sbyin par bya // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the beginner should practice generosity.

translated: Now, the meaning of the abode will be explained.🔽It is said:

analyzed: gang tshe tshangs pa'i tshigs su sems // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: @293b tshangs pa'i sgras ni byang chub sems kyi dga' ba'i yid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word brahma refers to the mind endowed with the joy of the bodhicitta.

original: rdo rje rtsa ba'i gnas ni tshigs de la mchog gi dga' ba'i gnas su 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgras snang ba mched pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtsa ba'i gnas ni tshigs de la mchog gi dga' ba'i gnas su 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgras snang ba mched pa ste /
translated: The abode of the vajra-base is the place of supreme joy. The word affliction refers to the increase of appearance.

original: lte ba'i gzugs su srog 'phro ba'i don to //
analyzed: lte ba'i gzugs su srog 'phro ba'i don to //
translated: It means the life-force flowing in the form of the navel.

analyzed: de ni dga' ba'i gnas te /
translated: That is the place of joy,

analyzed: rim pas bshad par bya'o // steng yang ma yin 'og ma yin //
translated: which will be explained in order.

translated: “Neither above nor below” and so forth: the “joint” is in the place of joy, between the two doors of the buddha-jewel mouth of the vajra and the jewel.

analyzed: de rnams brdas bshad pa ni snang ba zla bar bstan te / snang ba las ni shar dus 'gyur //
translated: The symbolic explanation of those is the teaching of the light as the moon.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: “From the light, the time of the east arises.”

translated: The “time of the good meaning” of the arising of the bodhicitta experienced as the gnosis of the bliss of the light is the joy that engages the aspiration.

analyzed: gang gis nyi ma yod pa dang // de ni nyi ma srog 'dzin ma //🔽zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: snang ba mched pa'i ye shes nyi ma bde ba khyad par can du gyur pa /
translated: The pristine wisdom of the increase of appearance is the sun, which is the special bliss.

translated: The life force is the wind whose nature is the bodhicitta, which is very good, the supreme joy. That very thing is indicated by the word “sun.”

original: mtshams ni snang ba thob pa nyid //
analyzed: mtshams ni snang ba thob pa nyid //
translated: The juncture is the attainment of appearance.

original: de yang me yi rang bzhin grags //
analyzed: de yang me yi rang bzhin grags //
translated: And that is renowned as having the nature of fire.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang ba thob pa'i ye shes shin tu yang khyad par du gyur pa'i bde ba me'i sgras bstan pa'i don to //

analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang me'i sgras snang ba gsum dang sbyar ba ni /

analyzed: dpal aindra bh'u tis dga' ba'i me tog gi phreng bar yang rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: The glorious Indrabhūti also extensively teaches this in the Garland of Flowers of Joy.
